title: Will Southeast Asian nations pick sides between the US and China?
content: The Association of Southeast Asian Nations, ASEAN, met for a high stakes summit.

title: Who is behind Tren de Aragua?
content: A look at the gang at the centre of US President Donald Trump’s immigration policy.

title: Israeli strike kills eight relatives of Palestinian photojournalist
content: Palestinian photojournalist Osama al-Arbid lost eight of his family members in an Israeli airstrike in Gaza City.

title: Sudan’s aid workers fear crackdown under strict new army rules
content: Aid workers fear arrest and worsening of hunger crisis that already threatens millions of people.

title: US to penalise foreign officials who ‘censor’ US companies, citizens
content: Trump administration has criticised countries for restrictions on expression, even as it cracks down on dissent at home.

title: Wheat shipment arrives in Syria as EU passes legislation to lift sanctions
content: The European Council extended asset freezes and travel bans on individuals linked to the former Assad government.

title: Fight for the Pacific – Episode 2: Fallout Zone
content: In the crossfire of a global power struggle, a compelling look at the impact of militarisation of the Pacific islands.

title: Why the US and Israel are pushing to privatize aid to Gaza
content: The US-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation will start distributing aid in Gaza, despite UN concerns.

title: Namibia marks inaugural Genocide Remembrance Day with call for reparations
content: Germany has acknowledged early 1900s genocide of Herero and Nama people, but reparations remain elusive.

title: French surgeon sentenced to 20 years for sex abuse of nearly 300 people
content: Joel Le Scouarnec tells court he committed 'despicable act' in another mass rape case that shocks France.

title: ‘Tidal wave’: How 75 nations face Chinese debt crisis in 2025
content: Developing countries to pay a record $22bn this year, mostly linked to loans from China’s Belt and Road Initiative.

title: A timeline of Israel’s starvation of Gaza in 2025
content: Dozens of Palestinians have starved to death in Gaza due to Israel’s total blockade on the enclave since.

title: What are Germany’s Taurus missiles that Ukraine wants?
content: German Chancellor Merz's recent comments cause speculation Berlin will finally send the weapons to Ukraine.

title: UEFA Champions League: Luis Enrique – The manager behind PSG’s run to final
content: Manager Luis Enrique will try to make 'treble' history as he leads PSG out against Inter in the Champions League final.

title: Boat capsizes on arrival at Spain’s Canary Islands; seven women, girls die
content: Local media reports say the small vessel appeared to be packed with more than 100 people.

title: Cultural Appreciation or Cultural Appropriation?
content: Today on The Stream: We dive into the space between cultural appropriation and appreciation.

title: Inquiry into deadly chemical plant explosion in China
content: Investigators in China are working to find the cause of a powerful explosion at a chemical plant that killed 5 people.

title: Preserving Oualata’s fragile manuscript legacy amid desert threats
content: Centuries-old manuscripts in Oualata libraries face destruction as desert sands encroach on ancient Mauritanian town.

title: New US plan for Gaza aid is “not just nonsensical, it’s cruel”
content: Rami Khouri of the American University of Beirut says Gazans are choosing being starving and being shot

title: Gaza aid chaos condemned by humanitarian leaders
content: At least 3 people died when thousands of starving Palestinians rushed to an aid distribution point.

title: Why millions of people don’t have enough to eat
content: On World Hunger Day, AJLabs examines how war, weather and wealth gaps drive starvation.

title: The cost of conscience: I lost friends for defending Palestinians
content: Bearing witness to injustice has a price. I paid it - and I would, again, because silence is complicity.

title: Gaza’s aid system isn’t broken. It’s working exactly as designed
content: What unfolded in Rafah on Tuesday was not a tragedy - it was the grim success of colonial humanitarianism.

title: Video: Paris protesters dye fountain red to signify Gaza bloodbath
content: Activists in Paris dyed a fountain red to symbolise what they called “the bloodbath” taking place in Gaza.

title: US pauses new student visas: What it means and who it will affect
content: The Trump administration has paused new visa interviews for international students set to attend US universities.
